result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan C Conner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bryan C Conner in court, in custody via phone.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  3:52 PM Court calls cases and recites appearances.  Court addressed Mr. Conner - defendant is requesting to return to probation.  Court makes stmt.  Defendant states he didn't remember signing the post-conviction relief forms.  Court continues to address the defendant re: to take the imposed/stayed prison sentence at the time of the original sentence.  Defendant makes stmt.  Court further addressed the defendant.  Atty Frost makes arguement - opposes this request.  Rebuttal by Mr. Conner.
COURT:  motion is denied - has the right to appeal today's decision
Defendant makes further stmt
Court further addressed the defendant

Bryan Conner appeared via video at Barron County Courthouse with Attorney Swan and Probation Agent Kim Gunderson appearing in person.  Atty Frost and Washburn County Clerk appear via phone.  Motion to amend JOC as defendant revoked himself from probation in 14 CF 20 and 14 CF 28.  Court:  Sentence is now imposed as the defendant refused probation sentence.
Sentencing hearing on May 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 11, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Bryan C Conner in court with attorney Mary Ann Hook Swan.  Defendant Bryan C Conner in custody.  Thomas Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 13 CM 249, 14 CF 16, 14 CF 20, 14 CF 21 and 14 CF 28.  Atty Swan waived preliminary exam.  Court addressed the defendant re: waiver of prelim.  defendant does not wish to have a prelim.   Court finds defendant has freely waived his right to a prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on March 31, 2014 at 03:45 pm.
Defendant Bryan C Conner appeared in custody with Atty Mary Ann Swan, Attorney Thomas Frost appeared for the State. Continued to March 31, 2014.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Bryan C Conner appeared with Attorney Mary Ann Hook Swan.  Attorney Thomas Frost appeared for the State. Also has 13CF110, 14CF21 and a status in 13CM249.
Court speaks with Ms. Swan. Mr. Conner has agreed to waive the prelim. Ms. Swan will also be requesting a subsitution on judge. Court speaks to Mr. Conner regarding waiving the preliminary exam.  Court finds the def. does understand the right to have a prelim.  Court finds probable cause in 13CF110. Court finds probable cause in 14CF16. Court finds probable cause in 14CF21. 
Court speaks to Ms. Swan regarding substiution. 
Mr. Frost serves the information to the court and to the def. 
Ms. Swan waives reading in all cases.
13CF110-Count 1 & 2 -NG Plea is entered
14CF21 Count 1 & 2- NG plea is entered  
14CF16 Count 1 & 2-NG Plea is entered 
13CM249 will track with the others. 
Bail will continue.
Preliminary hearing on February 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant, Bryan C Conner appeared with Attorney Mary Ann Hook Swan.  Attorney Thomas Frost appeared for the State.  Also has 14 CF 20, 14 CF 21, 13 CF 110 and 13 CM 249.  Atty Swan to represent the defendant on all cases.  State makes stmt.  Atty Swan waived reading of complaints for 14 CF 20, 21 and 16.  Court entered not guilty to misd.  Brendan Harrington is officer in 14 CF 20.  Court will recuse in 14 CF 20 as officer is the court's 1st cousin.  State addressed the Court requests $1000.00 cash.  Atty Swan addressed the Court. Court bail will continue.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.
